rename.from: Did Contains stopped working on empty list in EF Core 8?
rename.to: Did Contains stop working on empty list in EF Core 8?

body:
Dear @roji, thank you for the quick response. Our query is created using AutoMapper based on the [documentation](https://docs.automapper.org/en/stable/Expression-Translation-(UseAsDataSource).html). 

I created a minimal example of the issue: [repository](https://github.com/jozseftuska/ContainsBugReproduction)
This same query was working fine in .NET 6 and EF Core 6.

Looking forward to your answer.
Thanks for the repros! I'm currently away but I'll take a look at this next week for sure.

issue.title: Allow empty inline collections

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32375

We translate inline query roots to SQL VALUES, which doesn't support empty sets (there must be at least one element); so we had an early check to detect this and throw an informative exception.

However, in the Contains case, we pattern-match the ValuesExpression and optimize it away to an InExpression, so no actual VALUES gets sent to the database. This PR removes the check - allowing ValuesExpression to get get converted to InExpression - and moves the check for empty ValuesExpression to the SQL generation phase.

body:
Minimal repro is any composing on top of an empty inline array:

```c#
_ = ctx.Blogs.Where(b => new int[] { }.Contains(b.Id)).ToList();
```

The above query in itself is of course contrived, but people may indeed be creating constant nodes programmatically via the Expression API, and this should translate.

Note that this repro doesn't work for List because of #32413.

issue.title: [release/8.0] Allow empty inline collections (#32414)

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #32375, backports #32414.

### Description

As part of the primitive collection work for EF 8, we now translate inline query roots to SQL VALUES, which doesn't support empty sets (there must be at least one element); so we had an early check to detect this and throw an informative exception.

However, in the Contains case, we pattern-match the ValuesExpression and optimize it away to an InExpression, so no actual VALUES gets sent to the database. This PR removes the check - allowing ValuesExpression to get get converted to InExpression - and moves the check for empty ValuesExpression to the SQL generation phase.

### Customer impact

Queries involving an empty array and Contains no longer translate. This particularly affects dynamic query scenarios where arrays are integrated into the query as constants (inline), and may happen to be empty.

### How found

Customers reported on 8.0

### Regression

Yes

### Testing

Added.

### Risk

Very low; quirk added.
